channel.title: Machine Learning on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Machine Learning on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: After teen suicide, OpenAI claims it is “helping people when they need it most”
item.description: ChatGPT allegedly provided suicide encouragement to teen after moderation safeguards failed.

item.title: OpenAI admits ChatGPT safeguards fail during extended conversations
item.description: ChatGPT allegedly provided suicide encouragement to teen after moderation safeguards failed.

item.title: AI Is Eliminating Jobs for Younger Workers
item.description: New research from Stanford provides the clearest available evidence that AI is reshaping the workforce—but it’s complicated.

item.title: AI Is Eliminating Jobs for Younger Workers
item.description: New research from Stanford provides the clearest available evidence that AI is reshaping the workforce—but it’s complicated.

item.title: With AI chatbots, Big Tech is moving fast and breaking people
item.description: Why AI chatbots validate grandiose fantasies about revolutionary discoveries that don’t exist.

item.title: The Hidden Ingredients Behind AI’s Creativity
item.description: Image generators are designed to mimic their training data, so where does their apparent creativity come from? A recent study suggests that it’s an inevitable by-product of their architecture.

item.title: The Hidden Ingredients Behind AI’s Creativity
item.description: Image generators are designed to mimic their training data, so where does their apparent creativity come from? A recent study suggests that it’s an inevitable by-product of their architecture.

item.title: College student’s “time travel” AI experiment accidentally outputs real 1834 history
item.description: Hobbyist training AI on Victorian texts gets an unexpected history lesson from his own creation.

item.title: Is the AI bubble about to pop? Sam Altman is prepared either way.
item.description: “Someone will lose a phenomenal amount of money,” says CEO while fundraising at record prices.

item.title: Do Large Language Models Dream of AI Agents?
item.description: For AI models, knowing what to remember might be as important as knowing what to forget. Welcome to the era of “sleeptime compute.”

item.title: Do Large Language Models Dream of AI Agents?
item.description: For AI models, knowing what to remember might be as important as knowing what to forget. Welcome to the era of “sleeptime compute.”

item.title: I Went to an AI Film Festival Screening and Left With More Questions Than Answers
item.description: Runway AI paired up with Imax to screen 10 AI-generated winning selections. The festival has been derided by some cinephiles, while others insist it’s part of a natural technological evolution.

item.title: I Went to an AI Film Festival Screening and Left With More Questions Than Answers
item.description: Runway AI paired up with Imax to screen 10 AI-generated winning selections. The festival has been derided by some cinephiles, while others insist it’s part of a natural technological evolution.

item.title: Sam Altman Says ChatGPT Is on Track to Out-Talk Humanity
item.description: The OpenAI CEO addressed GPT-5 backlash, the AI bubble—and why he’s willing to spend trillions of dollars to win.

item.title: Sam Altman Says ChatGPT Is on Track to Out-Talk Humanity
item.description: The OpenAI CEO addressed GPT-5 backlash, the AI bubble—and why he’s willing to spend trillions of dollars to win.

item.title: Is AI really trying to escape human control and blackmail people?
item.description: Opinion: Theatrical testing scenarios explain why AI models produce alarming outputs—and why we fall for it.

item.title: GPT-5 Doesn't Dislike You—It Might Just Need a Benchmark for Emotional Intelligence
item.description: Researchers studying the emotional impact of tools like ChatGPT propose a new kind of benchmark that measures a models’ emotional and social impact.

item.title: GPT-5 Doesn't Dislike You—It Might Just Need a Benchmark for Emotional Intelligence
item.description: Researchers studying the emotional impact of tools like ChatGPT propose a new kind of benchmark that measures a models’ emotional and social impact.

item.title: OpenAI brings back GPT-4o after user revolt
item.description: After unpopular GPT-5 launch, OpenAI begins restoring optional access to previous AI models.

item.title: Why it’s a mistake to ask chatbots about their mistakes
item.description: The tendency to ask AI bots to explain themselves reveals widespread misconceptions about how they work.

item.title: The GPT-5 rollout has been a big mess
item.description: OpenAI faces backlash as users complain about broken workflows and losing AI friends.

item.title: OpenAI launches GPT-5 free to all ChatGPT users
item.description: New model claims fewer confabulations, better coding, and “safe completions” approach.

item.title: Nuclear Experts Say Mixing AI and Nuclear Weapons Is Inevitable
item.description: Human judgement remains central to the launch of nuclear weapons. But experts say it’s a matter of when, not if, artificial intelligence will get baked into the world’s most dangerous systems.

item.title: Nuclear Experts Say Mixing AI and Nuclear Weapons Is Inevitable
item.description: Human judgement remains central to the launch of nuclear weapons. But experts say it’s a matter of when, not if, artificial intelligence will get baked into the world’s most dangerous systems.

item.title: At $250 million, top AI salaries dwarf those of the Manhattan Project and the Space Race
item.description: A 24 year-old AI researcher will earn 327x what Oppenheimer made while developing the atomic bomb.

item.title: Google’s Newest AI Model Acts like a Satellite to Track Climate Change
item.description: Part of Google Earth Engine, AlphaEarth Foundations is a chip off Google’s DeepMind AI block—and it’s here to help save the world.

item.title: Google’s Newest AI Model Acts like a Satellite to Track Climate Change
item.description: Part of Google Earth Engine, AlphaEarth Foundations is a chip off Google’s DeepMind AI block—and it’s here to help save the world.

item.title: So far, only one-third of Americans have ever used AI for work
item.description: AP survey shows most Americans treat AI chatbots like a search engine replacement.

item.title: I Watched AI Agents Try to Hack My Vibe-Coded Websit
item.description: RunSybil, a startup founded by OpenAI’s first security researcher, deploys agents that probe websites for vulnerabilities—part of a new AI era for cybersecurity.

item.title: I Watched AI Agents Try to Hack My Vibe-Coded Websit
item.description: RunSybil, a startup founded by OpenAI’s first security researcher, deploys agents that probe websites for vulnerabilities—part of a new AI era for cybersecurity.

item.title: AI in Wyoming may soon use more electricity than state’s human residents
item.description: Proposed datacenter would demand 5x Wyoming’s current power use at full deployment.

item.title: OpenAI’s ChatGPT Agent casually clicks through “I am not a robot” verification test
item.description: “This step is necessary to prove I’m not a bot,” wrote the bot as it passed an anti-AI screening step.

item.title: OpenAI’s most capable AI model, GPT-5, may be coming in August
item.description: Sources say new model combines o3 reasoning with general GPT capabilities.

item.title: Two major AI coding tools wiped out user data after making cascading mistakes
item.description: “I have failed you completely and catastrophically,” wrote Gemini.

item.title: Cursor’s New Bugbot Is Designed to Save Vibe Coders From Themselves
item.description: One of the most popular platforms for AI-assisted programming says the next era of vibe coding is all about supercharging error detection.

item.title: Cursor’s New Bugbot Is Designed to Save Vibe Coders From Themselves
item.description: One of the most popular platforms for AI-assisted programming says the next era of vibe coding is all about supercharging error detection.

item.title: White House unveils sweeping plan to “win” global AI race through deregulation
item.description: Trump’s “AI Action Plan” reverses regulations, sparks critical pushback.

item.title: OpenAI and partners are building a massive AI data center in Texas
item.description: “Easy to throw around numbers, but this is a gigantic infrastructure project.”

item.title: OpenAI jumps gun on International Math Olympiad gold medal announcement
item.description: Non-math AI model reportedly solves proofs at human speeds, but early reveal roils community.

item.title: Exhausted man defeats AI model in world coding championship
item.description: “Humanity has prevailed (for now!),” writes winner after 10-hour coding marathon against OpenAI.

item.title: ChatGPT’s new AI agent can browse the web and create PowerPoint slideshows
item.description: New “agentic” AI feature combines web browsing with task-execution abilities.

item.title: This AI Warps Live Video in Real Time
item.description: A startup called Decart has developed an AI model that can transform live footage. The results are mind-bending—and poised to take over streaming.

item.title: This AI Warps Live Video in Real Time
item.description: A startup called Decart has developed an AI model that can transform live footage. The results are mind-bending—and poised to take over streaming.

item.title: Google hides secret message in name list of 3,295 AI researchers
item.description: Gemini 2.5 paper hides Easter egg in massive author list—but why so many contributors?

item.title: Why it takes 3,295 people to write one Google AI paper
item.description: Gemini 2.5 paper hides Easter egg in massive author list—but why so many contributors?

item.title: Former Top Google Researchers Have Made A New Kind of AI Agent
item.description: The mission? Teaching models to better understand how to build code will lead to superintelligent AI.

item.title: Former Top Google Researchers Have Made A New Kind of AI Agent
item.description: The mission? Teaching models to better understand how to build code will lead to superintelligent AI.

item.title: Another High-Profile OpenAI Researcher Departs for Meta
item.description: Jason Wei, who worked on OpenAI’s o3 and deep research models, will be joining Meta’s superintelligence lab. His colleague Hyung Won Chung is also joining Meta, a source tells WIRED.

item.title: Another High-Profile OpenAI Researcher Departs for Meta
item.description: Jason Wei, who worked on OpenAI’s o3 and deep research models, will be joining Meta’s superintelligence lab. His colleague Hyung Won Chung is also joining Meta, a source tells WIRED.

item.title: Chinese firms rush for Nvidia chips as US prepares to lift ban
item.description: H20 chips, designed to skirt export bans, are back after Trump meets with CEO.

item.title: New Grok AI model surprises experts by checking Elon Musk’s views before answering
item.description: Grok 4’s “reasoning” shows cases where the chatbot consults Musk posts to answer divisive questions.

item.title: AI 'Nudify' Websites Are Raking in Millions of Dollars
item.description: Millions of people are accessing harmful AI “nudify” websites. New analysis says the sites are making millions and rely on tech from US companies.

item.title: AI 'Nudify' Websites Are Raking in Millions of Dollars
item.description: Millions of people are accessing harmful AI “nudify” websites. New analysis says the sites are making millions and rely on tech from US companies.

item.title: AI therapy bots fuel delusions and give dangerous advice, Stanford study finds
item.description: Popular chatbots serve as poor replacements for human therapists, but study authors call for nuance.

item.title: AI Technology Breakthrough: New Algorithm Boosts Machine Learning Efficiency by 50%
item.description: Latest research shows new deep learning algorithms can significantly improve ML model training efficiency
